New in version 3.10: Added support for Java 9+ version parsing.

New in version 3.10: Ice 3.7 support, including new components, programs and the Nuget package.
New in version 3.10: Major overhaul of the module: many new variables, per-language components, support for a wider variety of runtimes.
New in version 3.10: Set CURSES_NEED_WIDE to TRUE before the find_package(Curses) call if unicode functionality is required.
New in version 3.10: Support for HDF5_USE_STATIC_LIBRARIES on Windows.
New in version 3.10: Support for installing Intel compiler runtimes.
New in version 3.10: The different dependency types PUBLIC, INTERFACE and PRIVATE are represented as solid, dashed and dotted edges.
New in version 3.10: The module exposes the components C, CXX, and Fortran. Each of these controls the various languages to search OpenMP support for.
New in version 3.10: The protoc compiler.

New in version 3.10: The result lines (with the exception of the #undef comments) can be indented using spaces and/or tabs between the # character and the cmakedefine or cmakedefine01 words. This whitespace indentation will be preserved in the output lines:
New in version 3.10: Variable to define with autogenerated descriptor files, if requested.
New in version 3.10: Variables for GLVND-specific libraries OpenGL, EGL and GLX.
New in version 3.11.
trans-unit.target: Nuevo en la versión 3.11.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.11: FLAME support.
New in version 3.11: Accept UTF-8 spelling for consistency with the UTF-8 RFC naming convention.
New in version 3.11: Added support for static libraries on Windows.
New in version 3.11: Added the INCLUDE_GUARD_NAME option.
New in version 3.11: Allow setting INTERFACE items on IMPORTED targets.
New in version 3.11: An ALIAS can target a GLOBALImported Target
New in version 3.11: Debug and Release variants are found separately and use per-configuration variables.

New in version 3.11: Many of the install() variants implicitly create the directories containing the installed files. If CMAKE_INSTALL_DEFAULT_DIRECTORY_PERMISSIONS is set, these directories will be created with the permissions specified. Otherwise, they will be created according to the uname rules on Unix-like platforms. Windows platforms are unaffected.

New in version 3.11: Optionally, using option GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS, native header files can be generated for methods declared as native. These files provide the connective glue that allow your Java and C code to interact. An INTERFACE target will be created for an easy usage of generated files. Sub-option DESTINATION can be used to specify the output directory for generated header files.
New in version 3.11: The <DOWNLOAD_DIR> substitution token.
New in version 3.11: The OPTIONAL_COMPONENTS option.
New in version 3.11: The SameMinorVersion compatibility mode.
New in version 3.11: The following environment variables can be used as hints: WX_CONFIG, WXRC_CMD.
New in version 3.11: The source files can be omitted if they are added later using target_sources().

New in version 3.11: There are situations where it may be undesirable for a particular config option to be automatically quoted by doxygen_add_docs(), such as ALIASES which may need to include its own embedded quoting. The DOXYGEN_VERBATIM_VARS variable can be used to specify a list of Doxygen variables (including the leading DOXYGEN_ prefix) which should not be quoted. The project is then responsible for ensuring that those variables' values make sense when placed directly in the Doxygen input file. In the case of list variables, list items are still separated by spaces, it is only the automatic quoting that is skipped. For example, the following allows doxygen_add_docs() to apply quoting to DOXYGEN_PROJECT_BRIEF, but not each item in the DOXYGEN_ALIASES list (bracket syntax can also be used to make working with embedded quotes easier):

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.12: BARE_FEATURES will define the compatibility macros with the name used in newer versions of the language standard, so the code can use the new feature name unconditionally.
New in version 3.12: Added Matlab Compiler Runtime (MCR) support.
New in version 3.12: Added support for C projects. Previous versions supported C++ project only.
New in version 3.12: Added the <PROJECT-NAME>_DESCRIPTION variable.
New in version 3.12: Debug and Release variand are found separately.
New in version 3.12: If ALL is set, the target will be added to the default build target.

New in version 3.12: If called from within a find module or any other script loaded by a call to find_package(<PackageName>), search prefixes unique to the current package being found. Specifically, look in the <PackageName>_ROOT CMake variable and the <PackageName>_ROOT environment variable. The package root variables are maintained as a stack, so if called from nested find modules or config packages, root paths from the parent's find module or config package will be searched after paths from the current module or package. In other words, the search order would be <CurrentPackage>_ROOT, ENV{<CurrentPackage>_ROOT}, <ParentPackage>_ROOT, ENV{<ParentPackage>_ROOT}, etc. This can be skipped if NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH is passed or by setting the CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH to FALSE. See policy CMP0074.

New in version 3.12: If the CONFIGURE_DEPENDS flag is specified, CMake will add logic to the main build system check target to rerun the flagged GLOB commands at build time. If any of the outputs change, CMake will regenerate the build system.
New in version 3.12: Object libraries can be linked to with target_link_libraries().

New in version 3.12: Search paths specified in the <PackageName>_ROOT CMake variable and the <PackageName>_ROOT environment variable, where <PackageName> is the package to be found. The package root variables are maintained as a stack so if called from within a find module, root paths from the parent's find module will also be searched after paths for the current package. This can be skipped if NO_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH is passed or by setting the CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_ROOT_PATH to FALSE. See policy CMP0074.
New in version 3.12: The optional <max> version.
New in version 3.12: When the project() command is called from the top-level CMakeLists.txt, then the version is also stored in the variable CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION.

New in version 3.12: While beneficial for individual options, the de-duplication step can break up option groups. For example, -D A -D B becomes -D A B. One may specify a group of options using shell-like quoting along with a SHELL: prefix. The SHELL: prefix is dropped, and the rest of the option string is parsed using the separate_arguments()UNIX_COMMAND mode. For example, "SHELL:-D A" "SHELL:-D B" becomes -D A -D B.
New in version 3.12: the BZip2 include directories
New in version 3.12: the version of the JPEG library found

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.13: install(TARGETS) can install targets that were created in other directories. When using such cross-directory install rules, running make install (or similar) from a subdirectory will not guarantee that targets from other directories are up-to-date. You can use target_link_libraries() or add_dependencies() to ensure that such out-of-directory targets are built before the subdirectory-specific install rules are run.
New in version 3.13: LINK_OPTIONS target property and target_link_options() command. For earlier versions of CMake, use LINK_FLAGS property instead.
New in version 3.13: stacktrace_* components.
New in version 3.13: Add support for Visual Studio generators.
New in version 3.13: Added ILP64 MKL variants (Intel10_64ilp, Intel10_64ilp_seq).
New in version 3.13: Added the COMPARE, CASE, and ORDER options.
New in version 3.13: Added the ENGINE_LIBRARY, DATAARRAY_LIBRARY and MCC_COMPILER components.
New in version 3.13: Added the RETURN_VALUE option.
New in version 3.13: Arguments to WORKING_DIRECTORY may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.13: Arguments to WORKING_DIRECTORY may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.13: Arguments to link_directories may use "generator expressions" with the syntax "$<...>". See the cmake-generator-expressions(7) manual for available expressions.

New in version 3.13: By default the directories specified are appended onto the current list of directories. This default behavior can be changed by setting CMAKE_LINK_DIRECTORIES_BEFORE to ON. By using AFTER or BEFORE explicitly, you can select between appending and prepending, independent of the default.
New in version 3.13: Debug and Release variants are found separately.
New in version 3.13: Hexadecimal numbers are recognized when prefixed with 0x, as in C code.
New in version 3.13: If the CUDAHOSTCXX environment variable is set it will be used as the default.
New in version 3.13: The FindCUDA module will use this variable to initialize its CUDA_HOST_COMPILER setting.
New in version 3.13: The <target> doesn't have to be defined in the same directory as the target_link_libraries call.
New in version 3.13: The GLOBAL argument will make the imported target available in global scope.

New in version 3.13: The directories are added to the LINK_DIRECTORIES directory property for the current CMakeLists.txt file, converting relative paths to absolute as needed. See the cmake-buildsystem(7) manual for more on defining buildsystem properties.
New in version 3.13: The error can be ignored by providing the IGNORE_SVN_FAILURE option, which causes these variables to remain undefined.
New in version 3.13: The result is formatted according to the option OUTPUT_FORMAT, where <format> is one of

New in version 3.14: If ARCH_INDEPENDENT is given, the installed package version will be considered compatible even if it was built for a different architecture than the requested architecture. Otherwise, an architecture check will be performed, and the package will be considered compatible only if the architecture matches exactly. For example, if the package is built for a 32-bit architecture, the package is only considered compatible if it is used on a 32-bit architecture, unless ARCH_INDEPENDENT is given, in which case the package is considered compatible on any architecture.
New in version 3.14: Imported targets.

New in version 3.14: Renamed Xxf86misc, X11_Xxf86misc, X11_Xxf86vm, X11_xkbfile, X11_Xtst, and X11_Xss libraries to match their file names. Deprecated the X11_Xinput library. Old names are still available for compatibility.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.15: <one_value_keywords> and <multi_value_keywords> that were given no values at all are collected in a variable <prefix>_KEYWORDS_MISSING_VALUES that will be undefined if all keywords received values. This can be checked to see if there were keywords without any values given.
New in version 3.15: Added the BUILD_ID option.
New in version 3.15: Added the CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE and CMAKE_PROJECT_INCLUDE_BEFORE variables.
New in version 3.15: Added the NOTICE, VERBOSE, DEBUG, and TRACE levels.
New in version 3.15: Alias for Boost::boost.
New in version 3.15: An interface library can have PUBLIC_HEADER and PRIVATE_HEADER properties. The headers specified by those properties can be installed using the install(TARGETS) command.

New in version 3.15: If FOLLOW_SYMLINK_CHAIN is specified, COPY will recursively resolve the symlinks at the paths given until a real file is found, and install a corresponding symlink in the destination for each symlink encountered. For each symlink that is installed, the resolution is stripped of the directory, leaving only the filename, meaning that the new symlink points to a file in the same directory as the symlink. This feature is useful on some Unix systems, where libraries are installed as a chain of symlinks with version numbers, with less specific versions pointing to more specific versions. FOLLOW_SYMLINK_CHAIN will install all of these symlinks and the library itself into the destination directory. For example, if you have the following directory structure:

New in version 3.15: If the CMake generator is the Green Hills MULTI and not overridden then the original project's settings for the GHS toolset and target system customization cache variables are propagated into the external project.
New in version 3.15: Non-library linker options reported by pkg-config are stored in the INTERFACE_LINK_OPTIONS target property.
New in version 3.15: The Boost_VERSION_<PART> variables.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.16.7: Added the GTK2::harfbuzz target.

New in version 3.16: A target-level dependency is added if any dependency is listed as BYPRODUCTS of a target or any of its build events in the same directory to ensure the byproducts will be available.
New in version 3.16: Added SKIP_REGULAR_EXPRESSION property.
New in version 3.16: Added CMAKE_FIND_USE_<CATEGORY>_PATH variables to globally disable various search locations.
New in version 3.16: Added OBJC and OBJCXX support.
New in version 3.16: Added the CMAKE_FIND_USE_<CATEGORY>_PATH variables to globally disable various search locations.

New in version 3.16: If USE_STAMP_FILE is set, the custom command defined by this function will create a stamp file with the name <targetName>.stamp in the current binary directory whenever doxygen is re-run. With this option present, all items in <filesOrDirs> must be files (i.e. no directories, symlinks or wildcards) and each of the files must exist at the time doxygen_add_docs() is called. An error will be raised if any of the items listed is missing or is not a file when USE_STAMP_FILE is given. A dependency will be created on each of the files so that doxygen will only be re-run if one of the files is updated. Without the USE_STAMP_FILE option, doxygen will always be re-run if the <targetName> target is built regardless of whether anything listed in <filesOrDirs> has changed.
New in version 3.16: If a module is found, the <prefix>_MODULE_NAME variable will contain the name of the matching module. This variable can be used if you need to run pkg_get_variable().

New in version 3.16: Messages of log levels NOTICE and below will have each line preceded by the content of the CMAKE_MESSAGE_INDENT variable (converted to a single string by concatenating its list items). For STATUS to TRACE messages, this indenting content will be inserted after the hyphens.
New in version 3.16: NVIDA CUDA OpenCL library. Available for CUDA version 5+.
New in version 3.16: NVIDA CUDA Tools Extension library. Available for CUDA version 5+.

New in version 3.17: Added the CMAKE_PROJECT_<PROJECT-NAME>_INCLUDE_BEFORE variable.
New in version 3.17: For MODULE library type, if option WITH_SOABI is specified, the module suffix will include the Python3_SOABI value, if any.
New in version 3.17: For MODULE library type, if option WITH_SOABI is specified, the module suffix will include the Python_SOABI value, if any.

New in version 3.17: Messages of log levels NOTICE and below can also have each line preceded with context of the form [some.context.example]. The content between the square brackets is obtained by converting the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT list variable to a dot-separated string. The message context will always appear before any indenting content but after any automatically added leading hyphens. By default, message context is not shown, it has to be explicitly enabled by giving the cmake--log-context command-line option or by setting the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW variable to true. See the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT documentation for usage examples.
New in version 3.17: To find and use the CUDA toolkit libraries the FindCUDAToolkit module has superseded this module. It works whether or not the CUDA language is enabled.

New in version 3.17: To make a log level persist between CMake runs, the CMAKE_MESSAGE_LOG_LEVEL variable can be set instead. Note that the command line option takes precedence over the cache variable.
New in version 3.18.

New in version 3.18: An ALIAS can target a non-GLOBAL Imported Target. Such alias is scoped to the directory in which it is created and subdirectories. The ALIAS_GLOBAL target property can be used to check if the alias is global or not.
New in version 3.18: Arm Performance Libraries support (Arm, Arm_mp, Arm_ilp64, Arm_ilp64_mp).

New in version 3.18: Support for OpenSSL 3.0.
New in version 3.18: Support for linking wrapped libraries directly (ARMA_DONT_USE_WRAPPER).
New in version 3.18: The cmake_language(CALL ...) command can also be used to invoke the function.
New in version 3.18: The cmake_language(CALL ...) command can also be used to invoke the macro.
New in version 3.18: The include directory for exslt.
New in version 3.18: This component includes two sub-components which can be specified independently:
New in version 3.18: Use CMAKE_OBJDUMP if set.

New in version 3.18: When a device link step is involved, which is controlled by CUDA_SEPARABLE_COMPILATION and CUDA_RESOLVE_DEVICE_SYMBOLS properties and policy CMP0105, the raw options will be delivered to the host and device link steps (wrapped in -Xcompiler or equivalent for device link). Options wrapped with $<DEVICE_LINK:...>generator expression will be used only for the device link step. Options wrapped with $<HOST_LINK:...>generator expression will be used only for the host link step.
New in version 3.18: libraries needed to use ruby from C.

New in version 3.19: <dir> may reference a binary directory.
New in version 3.19: <dirs> may reference a binary directory.

New in version 3.19: COMPATIBILITY_MODEAnyNewerVersion, SameMajorVersion and SameMinorVersion handle the version range if any is specified (see find_package() command for the details). ExactVersion mode is incompatible with version ranges and will display an author warning if one is specified.
New in version 3.19: FlexiBLAS support.
New in version 3.19: bzip2 and zlib components on all platforms.
New in version 3.19: Added the SDL_INCLUDE_DIRS, SDL_LIBRARIES and SDL_VERSION[_<PART>] variables.
New in version 3.19: Added the Xaw, xcb_util, and xcb_xfixes libraries.
New in version 3.19: An interface library target may be created with source files:

New in version 3.19: If CMP0114 is set to NEW, step targets are fully responsible for holding the custom commands implementing their steps. The primary target created by ExternalProject_Add depends on the step targets, and the step targets depend on each other. The target-level dependencies match the file-level dependencies used by the custom commands for each step. The targets for steps created with ExternalProject_Add_Step()'s INDEPENDENT option do not depend on the external targets specified by ExternalProject_Add()'s DEPENDS option. The predefined steps mkdir, download, update, and patch are independent.

New in version 3.19: If <file> is not specified for file(DOWNLOAD), the file is not saved. This can be useful if you want to know if a file can be downloaded (for example, to check that it exists) without actually saving it anywhere.
New in version 3.19: QNX support.

New in version 3.19: The compression level can be specified with the COMPRESSION_LEVEL option. The <compression-level> should be between 0-9, with the default being 0. The COMPRESSION option must be present when COMPRESSION_LEVEL is given.
New in version 3.19: This module defines IMPORTED target Vulkan::glslc, if Vulkan and the GLSLC SPIR-V compiler has been found.

New in version 3.19: When a version is requested, it can be specified as a simple value or as a range. For a detailed description of version range usage and capabilities, refer to the find_package() command.

New in version 3.19: When a version is requested, it can be specified as a simple value or as a range. For a detailed description of version range usage and capabilities, refer to the find_package() command.
New in version 3.1: Added support for tbz2, .tar.xz, .txz, and .7z extensions.
New in version 3.1: Arguments to DEPENDS may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.1: Command signatures that install files may print messages during installation. Use the CMAKE_INSTALL_MESSAGE variable to control which messages are printed.
New in version 3.1: Go and Lua language support.

New in version 3.1: If the INSTALL_PREFIX argument is passed, this is used as base path to calculate all the relative paths. The <path> argument must be an absolute path. If this argument is not passed, the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX variable will be used instead. The default value is good when generating a FooConfig.cmake file to use your package from the install tree. When generating a FooConfig.cmake file to use your package from the build tree this option should be used.
New in version 3.1: If the command line client executable is found the following macro is defined:
New in version 3.1: Library target can be an OBJECT library.
New in version 3.1: Source arguments to add_executable may use "generator expressions" with the syntax $<...>. See the cmake-generator-expressions(7) manual for available expressions.
New in version 3.1: Source arguments to add_library may use "generator expressions" with the syntax $<...>. See the cmake-generator-expressions(7) manual for available expressions.

New in version 3.1: The CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH, CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_PATH, and CMAKE_APPBUNDLE_PATH cache and environment variables will be added to the pkg-config search path. The NO_CMAKE_PATH and NO_CMAKE_ENVIRONMENT_PATH arguments disable this behavior for the cache variables and environment variables respectively. The PKG_CONFIG_USE_CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH variable set to FALSE disables this behavior globally.
New in version 3.1: The MESSAGE_NEVER option disables file installation status output.
New in version 3.1: The PKG_CONFIG environment variable can be used as a hint.
New in version 3.1: execute quietly without messages.

This is required to export the interface target generated by GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS option. If BUILD directory is not specified, a default directory will be used.
New in version 3.20: add_custom_command supports the Ninja Multi-Config generator's cross-config capabilities. See the generator documentation for more information.
New in version 3.20: add_custom_target supports the Ninja Multi-Config generator's cross-config capabilities. See the generator documentation for more information.

New in version 3.20: Added the support of Makefile Generators.

New in version 3.20: Arguments to OUTPUT may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.20: Elbrus Math Library support (EML, EML_mt).

New in version 3.20: It is now possible to export the target generated by GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS option.
New in version 3.20: One may use generator expressions to specify per-configuration byproducts. For example, the code:
New in version 3.20: One may use generator expressions to specify per-configuration outputs. For example, the code:

New in version 3.20: The target generated by option GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS has the property NATIVE_HEADERS_DIRECTORY which specify the directory holding the native headers.
New in version 3.20: This module defines IMPORTED target Intl::Intl.
New in version 3.20: This module defines the following IMPORTED targets:
New in version 3.20: Upstream GTestConfig.cmake is used if possible.
New in version 3.2: Added MSVC and AppleClang compiler support.
New in version 3.2: Added the UTF-16LE, UTF-16BE, UTF-32LE, UTF-32BE encodings.
New in version 3.2: CUDA Direct Solver library. Only available for CUDA version 7.0+.
New in version 3.2: Component processing; support for htlatex, pdftops, Biber, xindy, XeLaTeX, LuaLaTeX.
New in version 3.2: If you wish to use the Gettext library (libintl), use FindIntl.
New in version 3.2: R language support.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.3: Added support for the CTEST_CUSTOM_COVERAGE_EXCLUDE variable.
New in version 3.3: Allow adding dependencies to interface libraries.
New in version 3.3: Allow exporting targets with INTERFACE_SOURCES.

New in version 3.3: An install destination given as a DESTINATION argument may use "generator expressions" with the syntax $<...>. See the cmake-generator-expressions(7) manual for available expressions.
New in version 3.3: Arguments may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.3: Arguments may use generator expressions.
New in version 3.3: By default GLOB lists directories - directories are omitted in result if LIST_DIRECTORIES is set to false.

New in version 3.3: By default GLOB_RECURSE omits directories from result list - setting LIST_DIRECTORIES to true adds directories to result list. If FOLLOW_SYMLINKS is given or policy CMP0009 is not set to NEW then LIST_DIRECTORIES treats symlinks as directories.
New in version 3.3: HDF5 library version
New in version 3.3: If the same file is named for both output and error then it will be used for both.
New in version 3.3: In order to match associated files in subdirectories, specify a RECURSE: option, e.g. DATA{MyDataDir/,RECURSE:,REGEX:.*}.
New in version 3.3: Per-configuration variables Boost_LIBRARY_DIR_RELEASE and Boost_LIBRARY_DIR_DEBUG.
New in version 3.3: Token replacement is extended to byproducts.
New in version 3.3: True if the given element is contained in the named list variable.
New in version 3.3: True if the given name is an existing test name created by the add_test() command.
New in version 3.3: Use CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR when running cross-compiled binaries.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.6: %s format specifier (UNIX time).

New in version 3.6: As an optional parameter (IGNORE_ITEM) a list of file names can be passed, which are then ignored (e.g. IGNORE_ITEM "vcredist_x86.exe;vcredist_x64.exe")
New in version 3.6: As an optional parameter (IGNORE_ITEM) a list of file names can be passed, which are then ignored (e.g. IGNORE_ITEM "vcredist_x86.exe;vcredist_x64.exe").
New in version 3.6: Contents of these variables may use generator expressions.

New in version 3.6: Set the CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_PLATFORM_VARIABLES variable to specify variables that must be propagated into the test project. This variable is meant for use only in toolchain files and is only honored by the try_compile() command for the source files form, not when given a whole project.
New in version 3.6: Set the CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE variable to specify the type of target used for the source file signature.
New in version 3.6: Support for find_package() version checks.
New in version 3.6: Support for new libarchive 3.2 version string format.
New in version 3.6: The IMPORTED_TARGET argument will create an imported target named PkgConfig::<prefix> that can be passed directly as an argument to target_link_libraries().

New in version 3.6: The target is being cross-compiled and an emulator is provided (i.e. its CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR target property is set). In this case, the contents of CROSSCOMPILING_EMULATOR will be prepended to the command before the location of the target executable.
New in version 3.6: Whether a short float (float16, fp16) is supported.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.7: %A and %B format specifiers (full month and weekday names).
New in version 3.7: %a and %b format specifiers (abbreviated month and weekday names).
New in version 3.7: bzip2 and zlib components (Windows only).
New in version 3.7: Added the CUSTOM_CONTENT_FROM_VARIABLE option.
New in version 3.7: Added the LESS_EQUAL and GREATER_EQUAL options.
New in version 3.7: Added the MAT_LIBRARY component.

New in version 3.7: Component-wise integer version number comparison (version format is major[.minor[.patch[.tweak]]], omitted components are treated as zero). Any non-integer version component or non-integer trailing part of a version component effectively truncates the string at that point.
New in version 3.7: Debug and Release variants are found separately.
New in version 3.7: Device runtime library. Required for separable compilation.

New in version 3.7: In addition to cmake language files, the EXPORT_ANDROID_MK mode maybe used to specify an export to the android ndk build system. This mode accepts the same options as the normal export mode. The Android NDK supports the use of prebuilt libraries, both static and shared. This allows cmake to build the libraries of a project and make them available to an ndk build system complete with transitive dependencies, include flags and defines required to use the libraries.

New in version 3.7: The PARSE_ARGV signature is only for use in a function() body. In this case the arguments that are parsed come from the ARGV# variables of the calling function. The parsing starts with the <N>-th argument, where <N> is an unsigned integer. This allows for the values to have special characters like ; in them.
New in version 3.7: True if the given string or variable's value is a valid number and greater than or equal to that on the right.
New in version 3.7: True if the given string or variable's value is a valid number and less than or equal to that on the right.
New in version 3.7: True if the given string or variable's value is lexicographically greater than or equal to the string or variable on the right.
New in version 3.7: True if the given string or variable's value is lexicographically less than or equal to the string or variable on the right.
New in version 3.8.
trans-unit.target: Nuevo en la versión 3.8.

trans-unit.source: New in version 3.8: %% specifier (literal %).

New in version 3.8: ALLOW_UNKNOWN_COMPILERS and ALLOW_UNKNOWN_COMPILER_VERSIONS cause the module to generate conditions that treat unknown compilers as simply lacking all features. Without these options the default behavior is to generate a #error for unknown compilers and versions.
New in version 3.8: A STATIC library may be marked with the FRAMEWORK target property to create a static Framework.
New in version 3.8: Added CUDA support.
New in version 3.8: Added the RETRY_COUNT, RETRY_DELAY, QUIET options.
New in version 3.8: Added the SHA3_* hash algorithms.
New in version 3.8: If CTEST_USE_LAUNCHERS is on in a ctest -S script the ctest_configure command will add -DCTEST_USE_LAUNCHERS:BOOL=TRUE to the cmake command used to configure the project.

New in version 3.8: If the QUIET_ON_EMPTY option is used, if only one type of package was requested, and no packages belonging to that category were found, then no output (including the DESCRIPTION) is printed or added to the VAR variable.
New in version 3.8: If the SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable is set, its value will be used instead of the current time. See https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/source-date-epoch/ for details.

New in version 3.8: Multiple content links of the same name with different hash algorithms are supported (e.g. img.png.sha256 and img.png.sha1) so long as they all correspond to the same real file. This allows objects to be fetched from sources indexed by different hash algorithms.

New in version 3.8: On Visual Studio Generators for VS 2010 and above, library files ending in .targets will be treated as MSBuild targets files and imported into generated project files. This is not supported by other generators.

trans-unit.source: Next let’s add some C++11 features to our project by replacing atof with std::stod in tutorial.cxx. At the same time, remove #include <cstdlib>.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, agreguemos algunas características de C ++ 11 a nuestro proyecto reemplazando atof con std::stod en tutorial.cxx . Al mismo tiempo, elimine #include <cstdlib> .

trans-unit.source: Next let’s test our application. At the end of the top-level CMakeLists.txt file we can enable testing and then add a number of basic tests to verify that the application is working correctly.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, probemos nuestra aplicación. Al final del archivo CMakeLists.txt de nivel superior , podemos habilitar las pruebas y luego agregar una serie de pruebas básicas para verificar que la aplicación esté funcionando correctamente.

trans-unit.source: Next let's add some C++11 features to our project by replacing atof with std::stod in tutorial.cxx. At the same time, remove #include <cstdlib>.
Next let's test our application. At the end of the top-level CMakeLists.txt file we can enable testing and then add a number of basic tests to verify that the application is working correctly.
Next modify tutorial.cxx to include the configured header file, TutorialConfig.h.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, modifique tutorial.cxx para incluir el archivo de encabezado configurado, TutorialConfig.h .

trans-unit.source: Next suppose that we want to distribute our project to other people so that they can use it. We want to provide both binary and source distributions on a variety of platforms. This is a little different from the install we did previously in Installing and Testing (Step 4) , where we were installing the binaries that we had built from the source code. In this example we will be building installation packages that support binary installations and package management features. To accomplish this we will use CPack to create platform specific installers. Specifically we need to add a few lines to the bottom of our top-level CMakeLists.txt file.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, suponga que queremos distribuir nuestro proyecto a otras personas para que puedan utilizarlo. Queremos proporcionar distribuciones binarias y de código fuente en una variedad de plataformas. Esto es un poco diferente de la instalación que hicimos anteriormente en Instalación y prueba (paso 4) , donde estábamos instalando los binarios que habíamos creado a partir del código fuente. En este ejemplo, crearemos paquetes de instalación que admitan instalaciones binarias y funciones de administración de paquetes. Para lograr esto, usaremos CPack para crear instaladores específicos de plataforma. Específicamente, necesitamos agregar algunas líneas al final de nuestro archivo CMakeLists.txt de nivel superior .

trans-unit.source: Next we add the desired compiler warning flags that we want for our project. As warning flags vary based on the compiler we use the COMPILE_LANG_AND_ID generator expression to control which flags to apply given a language and a set of compiler ids as seen below:
trans-unit.target: A continuación, agregamos las banderas de advertencia del compilador deseadas que queremos para nuestro proyecto. Como los indicadores de advertencia varían según el compilador, usamos la expresión del generador COMPILE_LANG_AND_ID para controlar qué indicadores aplicar dado un lenguaje y un conjunto de identificadores de compilador como se ve a continuación:

trans-unit.source: Next we are going to refactor MathFunctions to become a real library that encapsulates using mysqrt or sqrt, instead of requiring the calling code to do this logic. This will also mean that USE_MYMATH will not control building MathFunctions, but instead will control the behavior of this library.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, vamos a refactorizar MathFunctions para convertirnos en una biblioteca real que encapsula usando mysqrt o sqrt , en lugar de requerir el código de llamada para hacer esta lógica. Esto también significará que USE_MYMATH no controlará la construcción de MathFunctions, sino que controlará el comportamiento de esta biblioteca.

trans-unit.source: Next we have to let CMake know that mysqrt.cxx depends on the generated file Table.h. This is done by adding the generated Table.h to the list of sources for the library MathFunctions.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, debemos informar a CMake que mysqrt.cxx depende del archivo generado Table.h . Esto se hace agregando el Table.h generado a la lista de fuentes para la biblioteca MathFunctions.

trans-unit.source: Next, navigate to the build directory and run CMake to configure the project and generate a native build system:
trans-unit.target: A continuación,navegar al directorio de construcción y ejecutar CMake para configurar el proyecto y generar un sistema de construcción nativo:

trans-unit.source: Next, set the IMPORTED_LOCATION property of the target using the set_property() command. This will tell CMake the location of the target on disk. The location may need to be adjusted to the <install location> specified in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: A continuación, establezca la IMPORTED_LOCATION propiedad del destino mediante el set_property() de comandos. Esto le dirá a CMake la ubicación del objetivo en el disco. Es posible que sea necesario ajustar la <install location> a la <ubicación de instalación> especificada en el paso anterior.

trans-unit.source: Next, update MathFunctions/mysqrt.cxx to use the mathfunctions and detail namespaces:
trans-unit.target: A continuación, actualice MathFunctions/mysqrt.cxx para usar las mathfunctions y los espacios de nombres detail :

trans-unit.source: Next, use the CPACK_INSTALL_CMAKE_PROJECTS variable to specify which projects to install. In this case, we want to install both debug and release.

Normally CMake requires that all targets built in a project have globally unique logical names (see policy CMP0002). This is necessary to generate meaningful project file names in Xcode and Visual Studio Generators IDE generators. It also allows the target names to be referenced unambiguously.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente, CMake requiere que todos los objetivos creados en un proyecto tengan nombres lógicos únicos a nivel mundial (consulte la política CMP0002 ). Esto es necesario para generar nombres de archivo de proyecto significativos en los generadores IDE de Xcode y Visual Studio Generators . También permite que se haga referencia inequívocamente a los nombres de destino.

También permite hacer referencia a los nombres de destino sin ambigüedades.

Normally CMake uses the build tree for the RPATH when building executables etc on systems that use RPATH. When the software is installed the executables etc are relinked by CMake to have the install RPATH. If this variable is set to true then the software is always built with the install path for the RPATH and does not need to be relinked when installed.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente, CMake usa el árbol de construcción para el RPATH cuando construye ejecutables, etc. en sistemas que usan RPATH . Cuando se instala el software, CMake vuelve a vincular los ejecutables, etc. para instalar RPATH . Si esta variable se establece en verdadero, el software siempre se construye con la ruta de instalación para el RPATH y no es necesario volver a vincularlo cuando se instala.

trans-unit.source: Normally CMake uses the build tree for the RPATH when building executables etc on systems that use RPATH. When the software is installed the executables etc are relinked by CMake to have the install RPATH. If this variable is set to true then the software is always built with no RPATH.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente CMake usa el árbol de construcción para el RPATH cuando construye ejecutables,etc.en sistemas que usan RPATH.Cuando el software es instalado,los ejecutables,etc.,son reenlazados por CMake para que el RPATH sea instalado.Si esta variable se establece como verdadera,entonces el software siempre se construye sin RPATH.

trans-unit.source: Normally CMake uses the build tree for the RPATH when building executables etc on systems that use RPATH. When the software is installed the executables etc are relinked by CMake to have the install RPATH. If this variable is set to true then the software is always installed without RPATH, even if RPATH is enabled when building. This can be useful for example to allow running tests from the build directory with RPATH enabled before the installation step. To omit RPATH in both the build and install steps, use CMAKE_SKIP_RPATH instead.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente, CMake usa el árbol de construcción para el RPATH cuando construye ejecutables, etc. en sistemas que usan RPATH. Cuando se instala el software, CMake vuelve a vincular los ejecutables, etc. para instalar RPATH. Si esta variable se establece en verdadero, el software siempre se instala sin RPATH, incluso si RPATH está habilitado durante la compilación. Esto puede ser útil, por ejemplo, para permitir la ejecución de pruebas desde el directorio de compilación con RPATH habilitado antes del paso de instalación. Para omitir RPATH en los pasos de compilación e instalación, use CMAKE_SKIP_RPATH en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: Normally an executable does not export any symbols because it is the final program. It is possible for an executable to export symbols to be used by loadable modules. When this property is set to true CMake will allow other targets to "link" to the executable with the target_link_libraries() command. On all platforms a target-level dependency on the executable is created for targets that link to it. Handling of the executable on the link lines of the loadable modules varies by platform:

Normally an executable does not export any symbols because it is the final program. It is possible for an executable to export symbols to be used by loadable modules. When this property is set to true CMake will allow other targets to “link” to the executable with the TARGET_LINK_LIBRARIES() command. On all platforms a target-level dependency on the executable is created for targets that link to it. For DLL platforms an import library will be created for the exported symbols and then used for linking. All Windows-based systems including Cygwin are DLL platforms. For non-DLL platforms that require all symbols to be resolved at link time, such as macOS, the module will “link” to the executable using a flag like -bundle_loader. For other non-DLL platforms the link rule is simply ignored since the dynamic loader will automatically bind symbols when the module is loaded.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente, un ejecutable no exporta ningún símbolo porque es el programa final. Es posible que un ejecutable exporte símbolos para ser utilizados por módulos cargables. Cuando esta propiedad se establece en verdadero, CMake permitirá que otros objetivos se "vinculen" al ejecutable con el TARGET_LINK_LIBRARIES() . En todas las plataformas, se crea una dependencia de nivel objetivo en el ejecutable para los objetivos que lo vinculan. Para las plataformas DLL, se creará una biblioteca de importación para los símbolos exportados y luego se usará para vincular. Todos los sistemas basados ​​en Windows, incluido Cygwin, son plataformas DLL. Para las plataformas que no son DLL que requieren que todos los símbolos se resuelvan en el momento del enlace, como macOS, el módulo se "vinculará" al ejecutable usando una -bundle_loader como -bundle_loader. Para otras plataformas que no son DLL, la regla de enlace simplemente se ignora, ya que el cargador dinámico enlazará automáticamente los símbolos cuando se cargue el módulo.

trans-unit.source: Normally the build RPATH of a binary contains absolute paths to the directory of each shared library it links to. The RPATH entries for directories contained within the build tree can be made relative to enable relocatable builds and to help achieve reproducible builds by omitting the build directory from the build environment.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente, la compilación RPATH de un binario contiene rutas absolutas al directorio de cada biblioteca compartida a la que se vincula. Las entradas RPATH para directorios contenidos dentro del árbol de compilación se pueden hacer en relación para habilitar compilaciones reubicables y para ayudar a lograr compilaciones reproducibles al omitir el directorio de compilación del entorno de compilación.

trans-unit.source: Normally, the function creates a dependency which will cause CMake to be re-run if any of the sources being scanned are changed. This is to ensure that the list of discovered tests is updated. If this behavior is not desired (as may be the case while actually writing the test cases), this option can be used to prevent the dependency from being added.
trans-unit.target: Normalmente,la función crea una dependencia que causará que el CMake se vuelva a ejecutar si se cambia alguna de las fuentes que se están escaneando.Esto es para asegurarse de que la lista de pruebas descubiertas se actualiza.Si no se desea este comportamiento (como puede ser el caso mientras se escriben los casos de prueba),se puede utilizar esta opción para evitar que se añada la dependencia.

trans-unit.source: Note that Boost Python components require a Python version suffix (Boost 1.67 and later), e.g. python36 or python27 for the versions built against Python 3.6 and 2.7, respectively. This also applies to additional components using Python including mpi_python and numpy. Earlier Boost releases may use distribution-specific suffixes such as 2, 3 or 2.7. These may also be used as suffixes, but note that they are not portable.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que los componentes de Boost Python requieren un sufijo de versión de Python (Boost 1.67 y posterior), por ejemplo, python36 o python27 para las versiones compiladas contra Python 3.6 y 2.7, respectivamente. Esto también se aplica a componentes adicionales que usan Python, incluidos mpi_python y numpy . Las versiones anteriores de Boost pueden usar sufijos específicos de distribución como 2 , 3 o 2.7 . Estos también pueden usarse como sufijos, pero tenga en cuenta que no son portátiles.

trans-unit.source: Note that CMake generates postSolution sections ExtensibilityGlobals and ExtensibilityAddIns by default. If you set the corresponding property, it will override the default section. For example, setting VS_GLOBAL_SECTION_POST_ExtensibilityGlobals will override the default contents of the ExtensibilityGlobals section, while keeping ExtensibilityAddIns on its default. However, CMake will always add a SolutionGuid to the ExtensibilityGlobals section if it is not specified explicitly.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que CMake genera las secciones postSolution ExtensibilityGlobals y ExtensibilityAddIns de forma predeterminada. Si establece la propiedad correspondiente, anulará la sección predeterminada. Por ejemplo, establecer VS_GLOBAL_SECTION_POST_ExtensibilityGlobals anulará los contenidos predeterminados de la sección ExtensibilityGlobals , manteniendo ExtensibilityAddIns en su valor predeterminado. Sin embargo, CMake siempre agregará un SolutionGuid a la sección ExtensibilityGlobals si no se especifica explícitamente.

trans-unit.source: Note that a macro, unlike a function, is expanded in place and therefore cannot handle return().

trans-unit.source: Note that any given value is ignored. It’s just checked for existence.

trans-unit.source: Note that configuration names are case-insensitive. The value of this variable will be the same as it is specified when invoking CMake. For instance, if -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=ReLeAsE is specified, then the value of CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE will be ReLeAsE.
Note that device linking is not supported for Object Libraries.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que la vinculación de dispositivos no es compatible con las bibliotecas de objetos .

trans-unit.source: Note that even if a test specifies a RESOURCE_GROUPS property, it is still possible for that to test to run without any resource allocation (and without the corresponding environment variables) if the user does not pass a resource specification file. Passing this file, either through the --resource-spec-file command-line argument or the RESOURCE_SPEC_FILE argument to ctest_test(), is what activates the resource allocation feature. Tests should check the CTEST_RESOURCE_GROUP_COUNT environment variable to find out whether or not resource allocation is activated. This variable will always (and only) be defined if resource allocation is activated. If resource allocation is not activated, then the CTEST_RESOURCE_GROUP_COUNT variable will not exist, even if it exists for the parent ctest process. If a test absolutely must have resource allocation, then it can return a failing exit code or use the SKIP_RETURN_CODE or SKIP_REGULAR_EXPRESSION properties to indicate a skipped test.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que incluso si una prueba especifica una propiedad RESOURCE_GROUPS , aún es posible que la prueba se ejecute sin ninguna asignación de recursos (y sin las variables de entorno correspondientes ) si el usuario no pasa un archivo de especificación de recursos. Pasar este archivo, ya sea mediante el argumento de línea de comandos --resource-spec-file o el argumento RESOURCE_SPEC_FILE a ctest_test() , es lo que activa la función de asignación de recursos. Las pruebas deben verificar CTEST_RESOURCE_GROUP_COUNT variable de entorno para saber si la asignación de recursos está activada o no. Esta variable siempre (y solo) se definirá si la asignación de recursos está activada. Si la asignación de recursos no está activada, entonces la variable CTEST_RESOURCE_GROUP_COUNT no existirá, incluso si existe para el proceso ctest principal . Si una prueba absolutamente debe tener asignación de recursos, entonces puede devolver un código de salida fallido o usar las propiedades SKIP_RETURN_CODE o SKIP_REGULAR_EXPRESSION para indicar una prueba omitida.

trans-unit.source: Note that fairly minimal checking is done for bad colors (although a value higher than what curses believes your terminal supports will be silently ignored) or bad syntax.

trans-unit.source: Note that it is the value of this policy setting at the end of the directory scope that is important, not its setting at the time of the call to install(CODE) or install(SCRIPT). This has implications for calling these commands from places that have their own policy scope but not their own directory scope (e.g. from files brought in via include() rather than add_subdirectory()).
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que lo importante es el valor de esta configuración de directiva al final del alcance del directorio, no su configuración en el momento de la llamada para install(CODE) o install(SCRIPT) . Esto tiene implicaciones para llamar a estos comandos desde lugares que tienen su propio alcance de política pero no su propio alcance de directorio (por ejemplo, desde archivos traídos a través de include() lugar de add_subdirectory() ).

trans-unit.source: Note that lock is advisory - there is no guarantee that other processes will respect this lock, i.e. lock synchronize two or more CMake instances sharing some modifiable resources. Similar logic applied to DIRECTORY option - locking parent directory doesn’t prevent other LOCK commands to lock any child directory or file.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que el bloqueo es aconsejable: no hay garantía de que otros procesos respeten este bloqueo, es decir, el bloqueo sincroniza dos o más instancias de CMake que comparten algunos recursos modificables. Lógica similar aplicada a la opción DIRECTORY : bloquear el directorio padre no impide que otros comandos LOCK bloqueen cualquier directorio o archivo hijo.

trans-unit.source: Note that lock is advisory - there is no guarantee that other processes will respect this lock, i.e. lock synchronize two or more CMake instances sharing some modifiable resources. Note that many compilers treat -DFOO as equivalent to -DFOO=1, but other tools may not recognize this in all circumstances (e.g. IntelliSense).

Si sus fuentes USE módulos, su ubicación debe ser especificada por INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES independientemente de esta propiedad.

trans-unit.source: Note that some of the types’ built-in defaults use the DATAROOT directory as a prefix. You cannot use DATAROOT as a TYPE parameter; please use DATA instead.

El prefijo DATAROOT se calcula de manera similar a los tipos, con CMAKE_INSTALL_DATAROOTDIR como la variable y share como el valor predeterminado incorporado. No puede usar DATAROOT como parámetro TYPE ; utiliza DATA en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: Note that the command invocation must appear in the CMakeLists.txt file itself; a call in an included file is not sufficient. However, the cmake_policy() command may be called to set policy CMP0000 to OLD or NEW behavior explicitly. The OLD behavior is to silently ignore the missing invocation. The NEW behavior is to issue an error instead of a warning. An included file may set CMP0000 explicitly to affect how this policy is enforced for the main CMakeLists.txt file.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que la invocación del comando debe aparecer en el archivo CMakeLists.txt ; una llamada en un archivo incluido no es suficiente. Sin embargo, se puede llamar al comando cmake_policy() para establecer la política CMP0000 en comportamiento OLD o NEW explícitamente. El comportamiento OLD es ignorar silenciosamente la invocación faltante. El NEW comportamiento es emitir un error en lugar de una advertencia. Un archivo incluido puede configurar CMP0000 explícitamente para afectar cómo se aplica esta política para el archivo principal CMakeLists.txt .

trans-unit.source: Note that the header path has changed from SDL/SDL.h to just SDL.h This needed to change because "proper" SDL convention is #include "SDL.h", not <SDL/SDL.h>. This is done for portability reasons because not all systems place things in SDL/ (see FreeBSD).

trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que la ruta del encabezado ha cambiado de SDL / SDL.h a solo SDL.h Esto tenía que cambiar porque la convención SDL "adecuada" es #incluye "SDL.h", no <SDL / SDL.h>. Esto se hace por razones de portabilidad porque no todos los sistemas colocan cosas en SDL / (ver FreeBSD).

trans-unit.source: Note that the implementation is 8-bit clean so source files may be encoded as UTF-8 on platforms with system APIs supporting this encoding. In addition, CMake 3.2 and above support source files encoded in UTF-8 on Windows (using UTF-16 to call system APIs). Furthermore, CMake 3.0 and above allow a leading UTF-8 Byte-Order Mark in source files.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que la implementación es limpia de 8 bits, por lo que los archivos fuente pueden codificarse como UTF-8 en plataformas con API del sistema que admitan esta codificación. Además, CMake 3.2 y superior admiten archivos fuente codificados en UTF-8 en Windows (usando UTF-16 para llamar a las API del sistema). Además, CMake 3.0 y superior permiten una marca de orden de bytes UTF-8 líder en los archivos fuente.

No hay comportamiento de herencia cuando se configuran propiedades, por lo que usar APPEND o APPEND_STRING con el set_property() no tendrá en cuenta los valores heredados al calcular los contenidos a los que añadir.

trans-unit.source: Note that usage requirements are not designed as a way to make downstreams use particular COMPILE_OPTIONS or COMPILE_DEFINITIONS etc for convenience only. The contents of the properties must be requirements, not merely recommendations or convenience.

trans-unit.source: Note that using the CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR or CMAKE_BINARY_DIR variables inside a toolchain file is typically undesirable. The toolchain file is used in contexts where these variables have different values when used in different places (e.g. as part of a call to try_compile()). In most cases, where there is a need to evaluate paths inside a toolchain file, the more appropriate variable to use would be CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR, since it always has an unambiguous, predictable value.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que el uso de las variables CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR o CMAKE_BINARY_DIR dentro de un archivo de cadena de herramientas suele ser indeseable. El archivo de cadena de herramientas se usa en contextos donde estas variables tienen valores diferentes cuando se usan en diferentes lugares (por ejemplo, como parte de una llamada a try_compile() ). En la mayoría de los casos, donde es necesario evaluar las rutas dentro de un archivo de cadena de herramientas, la variable más apropiada para usar sería CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR , ya que siempre tiene un valor predecible y sin ambigüedades.

trans-unit.source: Note that while Windows environment variable names are case-insensitive, variable names within a preset are still case-sensitive. This may lead to unexpected results when using inconsistent casing. For best results, keep the casing of environment variable names consistent.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que mientras que los nombres de las variables del entorno de Windows no distinguen entre mayúsculas y minúsculas,los nombres de las variables dentro de un preajuste siguen distinguiendo entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.Esto puede dar lugar a resultados inesperados cuando se utiliza una caja inconsistente.Para obtener los mejores resultados,mantenga la coherencia de la carcasa de los nombres de las variables de entorno.

trans-unit.source: Note that with Visual Studio Generators and Xcode there is no way to represent target-wide compile definitions or include directories separately for C and CXX languages. Also, with Visual Studio Generators there is no way to represent target-wide flags separately for C and CXX languages. Under these generators, expressions for both C and C++ sources will be evaluated using CXX if there are any C++ sources and otherwise using C. A workaround is to create separate libraries for each source file language instead:
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que con Visual Studio Generators y Xcode no hay forma de representar definiciones de compilación para todo el destino o incluir directorios por separado para los C y CXX . Además, con los generadores de Visual Studio no hay forma de representar indicadores de todo el destino por separado para los C y CXX . En virtud de estos generadores, expresiones, tanto para las fuentes de C y C ++ serán evaluados usando CXX si hay algún ++ fuentes de C y de lo contrario utilizando C . Una solución alternativa es crear bibliotecas separadas para cada idioma de archivo de origen:

trans-unit.source: Now let us make the MathFunctions library optional. While for the tutorial there really isn't any need to do so, for larger projects this is a common occurrence. The first step is to add an option to the top-level CMakeLists.txt file.
Now let’s add these defines to TutorialConfig.h.in so that we can use them from mysqrt.cxx:

trans-unit.source: Now let's update the value of USE_MYMATH. The easiest way is to use the cmake-gui or ccmake if you're in the terminal. Or, alternatively, if you want to change the option from the command-line, try:
Now let's use the generated table. First, modify mysqrt.cxx to include Table.h. Next, we can rewrite the mysqrt function to use the table:
Now run the cmake executable or the cmake-gui to configure the project and then build it with your chosen build tool.
trans-unit.target: Ahora ejecute el ejecutable cmake o cmake-gui para configurar el proyecto y luego compílelo con la herramienta de compilación elegida.

trans-unit.source: Now that both the debug and release builds are complete, we can use a custom configuration file to package both builds into a single release. In the Step12 directory, create a file called MultiCPackConfig.cmake. In this file, first include the default configuration file that was created by the cmake executable.
trans-unit.target: Ahora que tanto las compilaciones de depuración como las de lanzamiento están completas, podemos usar un archivo de configuración personalizado para empaquetar ambas compilaciones en una única versión. En el directorio Step12 , cree un archivo llamado MultiCPackConfig.cmake . En este archivo, primero incluya el archivo de configuración predeterminado que fue creado por el ejecutable cmake .

trans-unit.source: Now that the MathFunctions library and header file are installed, we also need to explicitly install the MathFunctionsTargets export details. Use the install(EXPORT) command to export the targets in MathFunctionsTargets, as defined by the install(TARGETS) command.
trans-unit.target: Ahora que la biblioteca MathFunctions y el archivo de encabezado están instalados, también necesitamos instalar explícitamente los detalles de exportación de MathFunctionsTargets . Utilice el comando install(EXPORT) para exportar los destinos en MathFunctionsTargets , según lo definido por el comando install(TARGETS) .

trans-unit.source: Now that we have MathFunctions being exported, we also need to explicitly install the generated MathFunctionsTargets.cmake file. This is done by adding the following to the bottom of the top-level CMakeLists.txt:
trans-unit.target: Ahora que tenemos MathFunctions exportando, también necesitamos instalar explícitamente el archivo MathFunctionsTargets.cmake generado . Esto se hace agregando lo siguiente al final del CMakeLists.txt de nivel superior :

trans-unit.source: Now that we have made MathFunctions always be used, we will need to update the logic of that library. So, in MathFunctions/CMakeLists.txt we need to create a SqrtLibrary that will conditionally be built and installed when USE_MYMATH is enabled. Now, since this is a tutorial, we are going to explicitly require that SqrtLibrary is built statically.
trans-unit.target: Ahora que hemos hecho que MathFunctions siempre se use, necesitaremos actualizar la lógica de esa biblioteca. Entonces, en MathFunctions/CMakeLists.txt necesitamos crear una SqrtLibrary que se construirá e instalará condicionalmente cuando USE_MYMATH esté habilitado. Ahora, dado que este es un tutorial, vamos a requerir explícitamente que SqrtLibrary se construya estáticamente.

trans-unit.target: Ahora que hemos especificado los requisitos de uso para MathFunctions, podemos eliminar de forma segura nuestros usos de la variable EXTRA_INCLUDES del CMakeLists.txt de nivel CMakeLists.txt , aquí:

trans-unit.source: Now that we've specified usage requirements for MathFunctions we can safely remove our uses of the EXTRA_INCLUDES variable from the top-level CMakeLists.txt, here:

Now we can build the project as described in earlier sections. To test using this package, we can use the project in Help\guide\importing-exporting\DownstreamComponents. There’s two differences from the previous Downstream project. First, we need to find the package components. Change the find_package line from:
trans-unit.target: Ahora podemos construir el proyecto como se describe en secciones anteriores. Para probar el uso de este paquete, podemos usar el proyecto en Help\guide\importing-exporting\DownstreamComponents . Hay dos diferencias con el proyecto Downstream anterior . Primero, necesitamos encontrar los componentes del paquete. Cambie la línea find_package de:

trans-unit.source: Now we can build the project as described in earlier sections. To test using this package, we can use the project in Help\guide\importing-exporting\DownstreamComponents. There's two differences from the previous Downstream project. First, we need to find the package components. Change the find_package line from:
Now we can create a CMakeLists.txt file for the MathFunctions project. Start by specifying the cmake_minimum_required() version and project() name:
trans-unit.target: Ahora podemos crear un archivo CMakeLists.txt para el proyecto MathFunctions . Comience especificando la versión cmake_minimum_required() y el nombre del project() :

trans-unit.source: Now we can import this executable into another CMake project. The source code for this section is available in Help/guide/importing-exporting/Importing. In the CMakeLists file, use the add_executable() command to create a new target called myexe. Use the IMPORTED option to tell CMake that this target references an executable file located outside of the project. No rules will be generated to build it and the IMPORTED target property will be set to true.
trans-unit.target: Ahora podemos importar este ejecutable a otro proyecto de CMake. El código fuente de esta sección está disponible en Help/guide/importing-exporting/Importing . En el archivo CMakeLists, use el add_executable() para crear un nuevo objetivo llamado myexe . Use la opción IMPORTED para decirle a CMake que este objetivo hace referencia a un archivo ejecutable ubicado fuera del proyecto. No se generarán reglas para construirlo y la propiedad de destino IMPORTED se establecerá en true .

trans-unit.source: Now we can start adding install rules and testing support to our project.
trans-unit.target: Ahora podemos empezar a añadir reglas de instalación y soporte de pruebas a nuestro proyecto.

trans-unit.source: Now we can use FindPackageHandleStandardArgs to do most of the rest of the work for us
trans-unit.target: Ahora podemos usar FindPackageHandleStandardArgs para hacer la mayor parte del resto del trabajo por nosotros

trans-unit.source: Now we need to create the package configuration file itself. In this case, the Config.cmake.in file is very simple but sufficient to allow downstreams to use the IMPORTED targets.
trans-unit.target: Ahora necesitamos crear el propio archivo de configuración del paquete. En este caso, el archivo Config.cmake.in es muy simple pero suficiente para permitir que los usuarios IMPORTED utilicen los destinos IMPORTADOS .

trans-unit.source: Now we need to find the libraries and include files; we use the information from pkg-config to provide hints to CMake about where to look.
trans-unit.target: Ahora necesitamos encontrar las bibliotecas e incluir archivos; pkg-config la información de pkg-config para proporcionar pistas a CMake sobre dónde buscar.

trans-unit.source: Now we need to setup debug and release builds. We can use CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to set the configuration type:
trans-unit.target: Ahora necesitamos configurar las versiones de depuración y publicación. Podemos usar CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE para establecer el tipo de configuración:

trans-unit.source: Now we will add a library to our project. This library will contain our own implementation for computing the square root of a number. The executable can then use this library instead of the standard square root function provided by the compiler.
trans-unit.target: Ahora añadiremos una biblioteca a nuestro proyecto.Esta biblioteca contendrá nuestra propia implementación para calcular la raíz cuadrada de un número.El ejecutable puede entonces usar esta biblioteca en lugar de la función estándar de la raíz cuadrada proporcionada por el compilador.

trans-unit.source: Now we’re ready to create a project to use the installed MathFunctions library. In this section we will be using source code from Help\guide\importing-exporting\Downstream. In this directory, there is a source file called main.cc that uses the MathFunctions library to calculate the square root of a given number and then prints the results:
trans-unit.target: Ahora estamos listos para crear un proyecto para usar la biblioteca MathFunctions instalada . En esta sección utilizaremos el código fuente de Help\guide\importing-exporting\Downstream . En este directorio, hay un archivo fuente llamado main.cc que usa la biblioteca MathFunctions para calcular la raíz cuadrada de un número dado y luego imprime los resultados:

trans-unit.source: Object libraries (a simple group of object files) are always treated as OBJECTS targets.
trans-unit.target: Las bibliotecas de objetos (un grupo simple de archivos de objetos) siempre se tratan como objetivos OBJECTS .

trans-unit.source: Object libraries may not be used as the TARGET in a use of the add_custom_command(TARGET) command signature. However, the list of objects can be used by add_custom_command(OUTPUT) or file(GENERATE) by using $<TARGET_OBJECTS:objlib>.
trans-unit.target: Las bibliotecas de objetos no se pueden usar como TARGET en el uso de la firma de comando add_custom_command(TARGET) . Sin embargo, la lista de objetos puede ser utilizada por add_custom_command(OUTPUT) o file(GENERATE) usando $<TARGET_OBJECTS:objlib> .

trans-unit.source: Obsolete. Specifies either <PackageName>_FOUND or <PACKAGENAME>_FOUND as the result variable. This exists only for compatibility with older versions of CMake and is now ignored. Result variables of both names are always set for compatibility.

trans-unit.source: On Visual Studio Generators for VS 2010 and above, library files ending in .targets will be treated as MSBuild targets files and imported into generated project files. This is not supported by other generators.

trans-unit.source: On Visual Studio Generators the selected platform name is provided in the CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_NAME variable.
trans-unit.target: En los generadores de Visual Studio, el nombre de la plataforma seleccionada se proporciona en la variable CMAKE_VS_PLATFORM_NAME .

trans-unit.source: On Visual Studio Generators, run before any other rules are executed within the target. On other generators, run just before PRE_LINK commands.
trans-unit.target: En Visual Studio Generators , ejecute antes de que se ejecuten otras reglas dentro del destino. En otros generadores, ejecute justo antes de los comandos PRE_LINK .

trans-unit.source: On AIX shared libraries may be named "lib<name>.a". This property is set to true on such platforms.
On AIX shared libraries may be named “lib<name>.a”. This property is set to true on such platforms.
trans-unit.target: En AIX, las bibliotecas compartidas pueden llamarse "lib <nombre> .a". Esta propiedad se establece en true en dichas plataformas.

trans-unit.source: On AIX, CMake automatically exports all symbols from shared libraries, and from executables with the ENABLE_EXPORTS target property set. Explicitly disable this boolean property to suppress the behavior and export no symbols by default. In this case it is expected that the project will use other means to export some symbols.
trans-unit.target: En AIX, CMake exporta automáticamente todos los símbolos de bibliotecas compartidas y de ejecutables con el conjunto de propiedades de destino ENABLE_EXPORTS . Deshabilite explícitamente esta propiedad booleana para suprimir el comportamiento y no exportar símbolos de forma predeterminada. En este caso, se espera que el proyecto utilice otros medios para exportar algunos símbolos.

trans-unit.source: On AIX, a linker "import file" is created along with the executable to list the exported symbols for import when linking other targets. Loadable modules link to the import file to get the symbols.
On AIX, a linker “import file” is created along with the executable to list the exported symbols for import when linking other targets. Loadable modules link to the import file to get the symbols.
trans-unit.target: En AIX, se crea un "archivo de importación" de enlazador junto con el ejecutable para enumerar los símbolos exportados para su importación al enlazar otros destinos. Los módulos cargables se vinculan al archivo de importación para obtener los símbolos.

trans-unit.source: On AIX, the linker import file created for executables with ENABLE_EXPORTS enabled.
trans-unit.target: En AIX, el archivo de importación del vinculador creado para ejecutables con ENABLE_EXPORTS habilitado.

trans-unit.source: On AIX: the linker import file (e.g. .imp) of an executable target created by the add_executable() command when its ENABLE_EXPORTS target property is set.
trans-unit.target: En AIX: el archivo de importación del vinculador (por ejemplo, .imp ) de un destino ejecutable creado por el add_executable() cuando se establece su propiedad de destino ENABLE_EXPORTS .

trans-unit.source: On Unix-like systems (including Mac OS X), the Unix Makefiles generator is used by default. A variant of that generator can also be used on Windows in various environments, such as the NMake Makefiles and MinGW Makefiles generator. These generators generate a Makefile variant which can be executed with make, gmake, nmake or similar tools. See the individual generator documentation for more information on targeted environments and tools.
trans-unit.target: En sistemas similares a Unix (incluido Mac OS X), el generador de Unix Makefiles se utiliza de forma predeterminada. Una variante de ese generador también se puede utilizar en Windows en varios entornos, como el NMake Makefiles y MinGW Makefiles . Estos generadores generan una variante Makefile que se puede ejecutar con herramientas make , gmake , nmake o similares. Consulte la documentación del generador individual para obtener más información sobre entornos y herramientas específicos.

trans-unit.source: On Unix-like systems (including Mac OS X), the Unix Makefiles generator is used by default. A variant of that generator can also be used on Windows in various environments, such as the NMake Makefiles and MinGW Makefiles generator. These generators generate a Makefile variant which can be executed with make, gmake, nmake or similar tools. See the individual generator documentation for more information on targeted environments and tools.

On Visual Studio and Borland compilers Boost headers request automatic linking to corresponding libraries. This requires matching libraries to be linked explicitly or available in the link library search path. In this case setting Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS to OFF may not achieve dynamic linking. Boost automatic linking typically requests static libraries with a few exceptions (such as Boost.Python). Use:
trans-unit.target: En los compiladores de Visual Studio y Borland, los encabezados Boost solicitan enlaces automáticos a las bibliotecas correspondientes. Esto requiere que las bibliotecas coincidentes estén vinculadas explícitamente o disponibles en la ruta de búsqueda de la biblioteca de enlaces. En este caso, establecer Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS en OFF puede no lograr la vinculación dinámica. La vinculación automática de Boost normalmente solicita bibliotecas estáticas con algunas excepciones (como Boost.Python ). Utilizar:

trans-unit.source: On Windows and macOS, globbing is case-insensitive even if the underlying filesystem is case-sensitive (both filenames and globbing expressions are converted to lowercase before matching). On other platforms, globbing is case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: En Windows y MacOS,globbing no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas aunque el sistema de archivos subyacente sí lo haga (tanto los nombres de los archivos como las expresiones de globbing se convierten a minúsculas antes de hacer la comparación).En otras plataformas,globbing distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: On Windows, cmake(1) can be used to generate solutions for the Visual Studio IDE. trans-unit.source: Once an imported target has been made global, it cannot be changed back to non-global. Therefore, if a project sets this property, it may only provide a value of True. trans-unit.source: One common use case for this module was to skip CMake’s checks for a working compiler when using a cross-compiler that cannot link binaries without special flags or custom linker scripts. This case is now supported by setting the CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE variable in the toolchain file instead.
trans-unit.target: Un caso de uso común para este módulo fue omitir las comprobaciones de CMake para un compilador que funciona cuando se utiliza un compilador cruzado que no puede vincular binarios sin indicadores especiales o scripts de enlazador personalizados. Este caso ahora es compatible configurando la variable CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE en el archivo de la cadena de herramientas.

trans-unit.source: One common use case for this module was to skip CMake's checks for a working compiler when using a cross-compiler that cannot link binaries without special flags or custom linker scripts. This case is now supported by setting the CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE variable in the toolchain file instead.

One example would be the usage of Objective-C (*.m) files, and Objective-C++ (*.mm) files, which lead to compilation failure because they are treated (in case of Ninja / Makefile generator) as C, and CXX respectively. The precompile headers are not compatible between languages.
trans-unit.target: Un ejemplo sería el uso de archivos Objective-C ( *.m ) y archivos Objective-C ++ ( *.mm ), que provocan un error de compilación porque se tratan (en el caso del generador Ninja / Makefile) como C, y CXX respectivamente. Los encabezados de la precompilación no son compatibles entre idiomas.

trans-unit.source: One problem that CMake users often face is sharing settings with other people for common ways to configure a project. This may be done to support CI builds, or for users who frequently use the same build. CMake supports two files, CMakePresets.json and CMakeUserPresets.json, that allow users to specify common configure options and share them with others.
trans-unit.target: Un problema que los usuarios de CMake a menudo enfrentan es compartir la configuración con otras personas para encontrar formas comunes de configurar un proyecto. Esto se puede hacer para admitir compilaciones de CI o para usuarios que utilizan con frecuencia la misma compilación. CMake admite dos archivos, CMakePresets.json y CMakeUserPresets.json , que permiten a los usuarios especificar opciones de configuración comunes y compartirlas con otros.

trans-unit.source: One thing to note about this is that the INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES and similar properties should only contain information about the target itself, and not any of its dependencies. Instead, those dependencies should also be targets, and CMake should be told that they are dependencies of this target. CMake will then combine all the necessary information automatically.
trans-unit.target: Una cosa a tener en cuenta sobre esto es que INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES y propiedades similares solo deben contener información sobre el objetivo en sí, y no ninguna de sus dependencias. En cambio, esas dependencias también deberían ser objetivos, y CMake debería saber que son dependencias de este objetivo. CMake luego combinará toda la información necesaria automáticamente.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, the runtime library search path for use when running an executable linked to shared libraries. The list should be used by user code to create the PATH on windows or LD_LIBRARY_PATH on UNIX. This should not be a cache entry.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, using option GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS, native header files can be generated for methods declared as native. These files provide the connective glue that allow your Java and C code to interact. An INTERFACE target will be created for an easy usage of generated files. Sub-option DESTINATION can be used to specify the output directory for generated header files.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente, utilizando la opción GENERATE_NATIVE_HEADERS , se pueden generar archivos de encabezado nativos para los métodos declarados como nativos. Estos archivos proporcionan el pegamento conectivo que permite que su código Java y C interactúen. Se creará un objetivo INTERFACE para un uso fácil de los archivos generados. La subopción DESTINATION puede usarse para especificar el directorio de salida para los archivos de encabezado generados.
